title: The Polls
question_text: A candidate running for office was polled at $57\%$ in City $1$ and at $52\%$ in City $2$. A newspaper decided to do a new poll and randomly selected $50$ people in City $1$ and $60$ people in City $2$ as to whom they would vote for. What is the probability that City $2$ can show the candidate ahead by at least $3\%$ over City $1$? Round to the nearest whole percent.
